Exposes types from the `request` module.  Fixes #322 

Note that this follows the pattern of other types we've made public like `ProvideAwsCredentials` and would be used externally as just `rusoto::DispatchSignedRequest` etc.

title: Try making Travis wait longer for compilation.
body:
https://github.com/rusoto/rusoto/pull/317 kept getting aborted by TravisCI since the build was spending >10 minutes on a compilation step without outputting anything.  Let's see if this works by making it wait longer!

Reference: https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/common-build-problems/#My-builds-are-timing-out

title: supports cn-north-1 region

https://github.com/rusoto/rusoto/pull/249 rebased, haven't gotten a chance to test and verify this.  There was some manual merge work with S3 that needs testings.

Also missing the `we haven't tested this since we don't have AWS China accounts` disclaimer on the rustdoc for `Regions`.

title: Updates to latest version of Hyper
body: Start of fixing #313 .  @adimarco is currently working on some XML things so I'll hold off on xml-rs.

title: Implement typed errors for all codegen
body:
This continues the work on typed errors started by #261, which implemented them for JSON protocol services.  

This PR implements typed errors for all other services produced by our codegen, and does away with the catch-all `AwsError` type altogether.

S3 remains the odd man out, though I have put in a S3-specific catch-all `S3Error` there to replace `AwsError`.  Implementing typed errors for each S3 method like we've done in the codegen would require a ridiculous amount of typing, and is better handled later in a different, yet-to-be-opened S3 cleanup project.

This builds on #291, so that one will need to get merged first.

title: Removes 1.9.0 from travis config, updates contributing to align with …
body:
…readme for minimum Rust version.

As mentioned in https://github.com/rusoto/rusoto/pull/306 .

title: Fix main build by annotating recursively defined types for serde
body:
Adds a hook to `GenerateProtocol` that allows implementing types to add arbitrary annotations to each `struct` field.  A default implementation is provided that adds nothing.

Uses that hook to add `#[serde(bound="")]` annotations to the recursively defined types that were causing the latest round of Serde explosions.

Fixes #302 - The build with all features and tests now passes.

title: Updates README on how to include Rusoto parts in the up to date manner.
body: Fixes issue #299 .  Cribbed from https://github.com/servo/servo/blob/master/components/compositing/Cargo.toml#L14 .

title: Adds Rust 1.9.0 to Travis config.
body: Adds Rust 1.9.0 to our list of versions to compile/test against.

title: add Cache-Control header to S3 put_object if present in the request
body: Should fix #303, or at least the Cache-Control part specifically mentioned.

title: Panic less with S3
body: This PR turns many s3 unwrap() calls into try!(). We were running into panics (which we couldn't handle, unlike errors) due to intermittent network failures.

title: Remove Syntex Build Dependency
body:
Remove the syntex build dependency declaration from the codegen `Cargo.toml` as well
as the codegen `build.rs`. The functionality utilizing syntex in the build
script was removed earlier, but the actual dependency was not (erroneously).

Stops the `ChainProvider` for waiting for all credentials providers to return.

Fixes #292

title: Reuse hyper client
set metadata fields, ACL, and content-type when doing an S3 put_object
body: Sets some fields that weren't getting added to the put object request.  Fixes #287

title: Don't recompile constantly when used as a crates.io dependency
body:
Prevents the build script from outputting the `rerun-if-changed=codegen` directive if the codegen directory doesn't exist in the first place (i.e., if it's being used as a crates.io dependency)

Fixes #285

title: Fixed the signed request doesn't match error when the path contains spaces
body:
I'm getting an signed request doesn't match error from aws when trying to upload a file with spaces in its name. It turns out that the canonical URI is not encoded, when encoding is required by aws:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/sigv4-create-canonical-request.html

title: Add the remaining JSON protocol services
body:
The codegen for the `json` protocol is now very good, and produces typed errors.  Every as-yet-unincorporated `json` protocol service from botocore that I've tried it with has worked flawlessly, both in terms of codegen and in terms of actually being functional in its interactions with AWS in the really-real world.

As such, there's no reason not to paint with a broad brush and include all the other `json` protocol services.  This PR is for that.  I'll be doing them one at a time and making sure each builds.  After that I'll go through and add some basic integration tests for them.  But if something as large and complicated as Kinesis (which we included with the last build) just works out of the box (I'm using it at work now), I have high hopes that the same can be said for the rest of these.

title: Pull AWS_SESSION_TOKEN from environment for credentials.
body:
Ran into this when running rusoto in a Lambda which has an IAM role allowing it to access S3. Fails before this change, succeeds after. 

This is also what botocore does: https://github.com/boto/botocore/blob/develop/botocore/credentials.py#L489

title: Fixed Serde errors
body:
Error: 
`error: mismatched types:
 expected `&mut syntex::Registry`,
    found `&mut inner::syntex::Registry`
(expected struct `syntex::Registry`,
    found struct `inner::syntex::Registry`)`

Fixed based on https://users.rust-lang.org/t/here-is-how-to-avoid-being-broken-by-syntex-updates/6189?u=dtolnay

title: stop using &mut self in generated service methods.
body:
This is almost done, I'll wrap it up tomorrow.

Fixes #277 - It turns out that the only place the credentials providers stored state and needed a `&mut self` was if they cached credentials to see if they had expired.  I made that functionality optional by creating an `ExpiringProvider` that wraps other `ProvideAwsCredential` implementations if it's wanted.  It uses a `Mutex` to ensure thread safety.

I updated all the codegen and the S3 hand-written code to stop using `&mut self` everywhere.  Still needs some tests and helper updates.

title: Update the link to rusoto helpers
Updates serde again.
body: Got errors building master, this fixes it.

title: Run codegen only when necessary
body:
This 1-line PR causes the rusoto build script to output `cargo:rerun-if-changed=codegen`, which tells cargo that the build script only needs to be rerun if something in the codegen directory changed, which is the only time that codegen actually needs to be rerun.  The generated code is entirely a function of the contents of that directory.

As things stood, the build script ran every single time any `cargo build` or `cargo test` was run, which dirtied the entire build and caused the whole crate to be recompiled every single time, even if literally nothing had changed.

The code that's generated by the build script (and lives under something like `target/debug/build/rusoto-002a4bb2634057d2/out/`) is still recompiled if something relevant in `src/` is modified, like you'd expect.  So, for example, if codegen has been run for dynamodb, and you modify `src/dynamodb.rs` (or anything else in its dependency tree like `src/credential.rs`), the generated code will be recompiled as a result of that change, but it won't be regenerated first because it doesn't need to be.

The practical upshot of this change is that it's now possible to make minor changes to tests and a few other things without waiting 30 seconds for the entire crate to regenerate and recompile each time.  

It also makes it possible to test out manual changes to the generated code to see if they'd have the desired effect.  e.g., you could make a manual tweak to `target/debug/build/rusoto-002a4bb2634057d2/out/dynamodb.rs` and run `cargo test --features dynamodb` to test the change before making it in the codegen itself, which saves rather a lot of time.

title: add ap-northeast-2 region
body: Fixes #207

title: Adds encrypted GH_TOKEN to travis config.
body: Looks like the Travis gem also did some reformatting.

title: add rusoto_helpers crate as non-dependency sub-crate
body:
Moves the contents of the `rusoto_helpers` repository back into this repo.

`rusoto_helpers` remains a standalone crate with a path depencency of `..` (and a version specified so it will `cargo package` up properly).  This crate explicitly excludes the contents of the `helpers` directory for builds and packaging.

This will make synchronized development of helpers and core rusoto features possible without separate pull requests for each repo.

title: tell serde to use Default::default() when a blob has no value
body: Fixes #263

title: Add kinesis client and typed errors for JSON protocol codegen
body:
This is a work in progress, but it's crudely functional and I'd like some feedback as I flesh out the rest of the kinesis helper.

The existing JSON protocol codegen worked out of the box for generating code for the Kinesis botocore definition.  It really needed typed errors, so I've taken a stab at implementing those.  I feel like I have a bit to learn as far as idiomatic error handling goes in Rust, but I think this is a big step in the right direction from the generic "all errors are AwsError" approach our existing codegen takes. 

Each method in the generated KinesisClient has an associated FooMethodErrors enum based on the botocore definition.  That's reflected in the Result return types, and allows the helper to do granular error checking.  e.g., the `create_stream()` method can check for a typed `CreateStreamError::ResourceInUseException` and ignore it to create streams idempotently.  (Note:  the `FooException` naming scheme is Amazon's, and comes straight from the parsed botocore)

As currently rendered, methods in `KinesisClient` with typed errors produce code like:

```
 pub enum DescribeStreamError {
    ResourceNotFoundException(String),
    LimitExceededException(String), 
    UnknownException(String) 
}

impl From<AwsError> for DescribeStreamError { ... }
impl Error for DescribeStreamError { ... }

fn describe_stream(&mut self, input: &DescribeStreamInput) 
    -> Result<DescribeStreamOutput, DescribeStreamError>
```

The `KinesisHelper` is currently defined in the rusoto crate proper, but can obviously be moved to the rusoto_helpers crate.  It currently implements CRUD for streams and has integration tests for that.

I'll be fleshing out the rest of the helper over the next day or two, but the generated `KinesisClient` works fine.

title: Fix `lazy_static` Usage
body:
# Issue

Due to [RFC 1440](https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/blob/82a969b5e0f8d6e75a4d581b06ddb6ddd9c5dee7/text/1440-drop-types-in-const.md), having types with destructors being used in static items and in const functions requires enabling the `drop_types_in_const` feature on nightly.

Since we use the `lazy_static!` macro to [lazily create a static Regex](https://github.com/rusoto/rusoto/blob/4878335df0963f0dc4ae807f0bfe5a83cc9f729e/codegen/src/generator/rest_json.rs#L127-L129), and `lazy_static` uses [`UnsafeCell` internally](https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/lazy-static.rs/blob/2005102f0684728567b6e7922ca843f06544c427/src/nightly_lazy.rs#L7), then as of [rust-lang/rust/pull/33130](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/33130), this change affects us. In the latest nightly versions, we require the `drop_types_in_const` feature to be enabled in order to compile.
# Solution

This PR enables the `drop_types_in_const` feature on nightly builds.
# Resources
- [rust-lang/rust/issues/30667 - UnsafeCell allows types with destructors to end up in statics.](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/30667)
- [rust-lang/rust/issues/33156 - permit `Drop` types in statics (tracking issue for RFC #1440)](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/33156)
- [rust-lang/rust/pull/33130 - Implement constant support in MIR.](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/33130)
- [rust-lang/rfcs/pull/1140 - RFC - Allow Drop types in statics/const functions](https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/1440)
- [rust-lang/rfcs - RFC 1440](https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/blob/82a969b5e0f8d6e75a4d581b06ddb6ddd9c5dee7/text/1440-drop-types-in-const.md)

title: Update `Clippy` Dependency
body:
This PR updates the Clippy dependency to `0.0.67` to allow it to build on the latest nightly (`rustc 1.10.0-nightly (2b79e05a0 2016-05-13)`). Additionally, it fixes code issues pointed out by the `doc_markdown` and `needless_borrow` Clippy lints by replacing a raw link in documentation with a Markdown link, and by removing all needless borrows.
# Relevant Links
- [Manishearth/rust-clippy/issues/902 - doc_markdown a bit too eager](https://github.com/Manishearth/rust-clippy/issues/902)
- [Manishearth/rust-clippy/wiki - needless_borrow](https://github.com/Manishearth/rust-clippy/wiki#needless_borrow)

title: EC2 support
body:
Add support for EC2 requests.

Closes #166
### Summary

`Ec2Generator`:
- Based on QueryGenerator, with details for EC2.
  
  According to the [documentation in botocore](https://github.com/boto/botocore/blob/dff99fdf2666accf6b448aef7f03fe3d66dd38fa/botocore/serialize.py#L259-L266):
  
  > The EC2 model is almost, but not exactly, similar to the query protocol serializer.
- Set `Version` field to `2015-10-01`.
  
  When missing, AWS returns an Internal Server Error.
- `message` in `AwsError` includes the body of the response.
  
  It is very convenient to see the error when AWS rejects the request.
- Ignore `Whitespace` events.
  
  XML is pretty printed in EC2 responses, so there are tons of `Whitespace` events between tags.
- Use `${Action}Response` tag name to deserialize `${Action}Result` shapes.
  
  For instance, `DescribeInstancesResult` is contained in a `DescribeInstancesResponse` tag.
- Lists are nested. For example:
  
  ``` xml
  <reservationSet>
   <item>..</item>
   <item>..</item>
  </reservationSet>
  ```

Global:
- Serialize timestamp with a string.
- Don't import `region::Region`.
  
  EC2 has a `Region` shape, so there is a conflict with both names.
- Rename `type` and `return` field names to `type_` and `return_`.
  
  These field names are present in some structures, but Rust compiler rejects them because they are keywords. I'm unsure if adding a suffix is the best solution.

`xmlutils`:
- `characters` accepts empty tags (like `<reason/>`)
- `start_element` skips `Whitespace` events until `StartElement` is found.
- `skip_tree` consumes a node tree. It is used to ignore unknown tags.

title: Add `travis-cargo` Support
body:
# Status
- [x] `.travis.yml`
  - [x] Update `.travis.yml` with necessary features for `travis-cargo` support.
    - [x] Add code to load `travis-cargo`
    - [x] Enable `doc-upload` and `coveralls` features of `travis-cargo`.
    - [x] Add encrypted `GH_TOKEN` variable
  - [x] Add `1.8.0` build train to `.travis.yml`.
  - [x] Add `osx` to os matrix in `.travis.yml`.
  - [x] Enable cargo caching in `.travis.yml` to speed up CI build time.
  - [x] Enable `cargo bench` and `cargo doc` commands in `.travis.yml` `script` section.
  - [x] Add `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` env var to `.travis.yml`.
  - [x] Enable `.travis.yml` builds on the `auto` branch.
    - This is necessary for future Homu support
  - [x] Re-deny CI build failures on the `beta` train
    - I don't think it's correct to allow CI build failures on the beta train because ideally you want to fix errors as they appear in nightly builds, before the propogate to beta builds
  - [x] Fix the way the `PATH` variable is generated to be OS-specific
- [x] `README.md`
  - [x] Bump minimum required version notice from `1.7.0` to `1.8.0`
- [x] Other
  - [x] Rename all instances of the `nightly` feature to `unstable` for compatibility
    with `travis-cargo`.
    - `travis-cargo` automatically adds the `unstable` feature to nightly builds, which we want (to test syntex macro codegen), but our equivalent feature was named `nightly` so I renamed it
  - [x] Remove `docgen.sh` in favor of `travis-cargo doc-upload`.
# Related Issues/PRs
- Might depend on #222 - Modify Travis CI Configuration to Execute All Tests
- Closes #226 - Modify Travis CI Configuration to Utilize `travis-cargo` 
- #247 - Add Homu Support
